snippet: Two government agencies are taking an interest in political groups hiding behind the tax code, and could shed light on the secret world of undisclosed political contributions.
abstract: Editorial welcomes the fact that both Eric Schneiderman, New York State's attorney general, and the Internal Revenue Service are looking into undisclosed political contributions to advocacy groups; observes that while investigations of the advocacy done by the United States Chamber of Commerce and groups like Crossroads Grassroots Political Strategies are unlikely to affect spending in the 2012 election, they are an important first step.
lead_paragraph: Two government agencies are taking an interest in political groups hiding behind the tax code, and could shed light on the secret world of undisclosed political contributions.
